meanings.definition: To apply beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to preapply for the job to increase her chances of getting hired.
meanings.sent2: I always preapply sunscreen before going to the beach to avoid sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The students preapplying for the scholarship were excited about the opportunity.
meanings.sent4: By preapplying for the loan, he secured a better interest rate.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preapply for the workshop to reserve your spot!

meanings.definition: The act of preparing or submitting an application before the deadline.
meanings.sent1: His preapplying for the grant helped him secure funding for his project.
meanings.sent2: The preapplying process for college can be stressful but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The early birds who were preapplying for the program got the best seats.
meanings.sent4: Her preapplying for the job interview gave her a head start over other candidates.
meanings.sent5: The company encourages preapplying to streamline the selection process.
